column4: hello, i am trying to get a game to work, and it specifies a range of network ports i need to choose from, when i list the ports in terminal, no ports are there in that range...anyone know how to create a new port? or any other way around this issue?
is it a game server or a game itself?
its an mmorpg...Final Fantasy XIV, so i believe game server
im complete noob with linux...i dont even know what appdb is, muchless how to find...can you give a lil more info plz
use web searches. Even the simplest search will find it. I promise
try using a little initiative, it really goes far
even if you literally search for just: appdb  you find what you need.
being new to linux is so over used. I am VERY sure you are not new to using the web to find out new stuff, are you?
lol, ive been trying to work on this for the past 8 hours...learned ALOT in that time as far as how to use terminal to get stuff done...still dont know too much tho
but you are good at finding new stuff out online....yes?
you are correct in that...just half asleep and not thinking completely straight atm lol, yeah im searching it now
so how is this any different?
oh ok, appdb as in wine correct?
yes as you are running a windows app
ok...well, yeah i have wine...i have the game fully installed...the question wasnt about how to install, was about how to set up a port
